benchmark_details.name: TriSense-2M
benchmark_details.overview: TriSense-2M is a large-scale multimodal dataset containing over 2 million annotations designed to support video temporal understanding tasks through the integration of visual, audio, and speech modalities, facilitating robust multimodal learning.
benchmark_details.data_type: video and audio samples with event-based annotations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for multimodal video understanding, enabling models to effectively integrate visual, audio, and speech information for tasks like moment retrieval and segment captioning.

data.source: Curated from long-form videos, enriched with annotated events across various modalities using an automated pipeline.
data.size: 2 million annotations from approximately 38,000 long videos
data.annotation: Automated annotation using fine-tuned large language models with manual quality checks

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on generated captions and retrieved moments against ground truth annotations for segment captioning and moment retrieval tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate a better alignment of the generated content with human-generated captions or the ability to correctly retrieve moments based on textual queries.
methodology.baseline_results: TriSense significantly outperforms other models like LongVALE and Qwen2.5-Omni on both TriSense-2M and existing benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Extensive experimental evaluations across multiple benchmarks and tasks.
